page.title: 12The Residents of Brownsea.
page.content: There are thirty inhabitants on Brownsea and they have lived there for periods varying from twenty-five years to two days.Most of them love it there and would not like to leave,but a minority would.One man moved to the island because of his job,left it,and has now been glad to return.Of the thirty inhabitants,twenty-two are permanent residents and the others live there in the summer only.One person was there when the island was first opened to the public by the National Trust.It used to be very overgrown then, so it has changed very much. There is a chief warden,who is in charge of the whole island,and a warden who is in charge of the nature reserve.The cafe owner has lived on the island for three years and there are shopkeepers,guides & receptionists
